title: Shipping the midnight deploys
content:
Late-night deploys force me to prune scope to only the essentials. I run through a tighter checklist, slice stories down to single responsibility, and leave feature flags on by default so rollbacks are instant.

The surprise benefit is clarity: every log line and metric tells a smaller story when I ship one change at a time. I wake up to fewer alerts, shorter diffs, and less guessing about what moved the needle.

This cadence also keeps me honest about recovery plans. Backups, migrations, and cache warmers get rehearsed weekly instead of sitting as theoretical exercises.
